# Task

Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.



# Special Instructions

{{instructions}}

Sure, I can help with the task. Here is a simple implementation using Julia DataFrames package:

```julia
using DataFrames

function add_yearmonth(df::DataFrame)
    df[:ym] = map(x -> Dates.formatmm(x,"yyyymm"), df.dt) |> Vector{Int}
end
```

This function adds a new column `ym` to the DataFrame that contains the year and month of each date in format "yyyymm". The `Dates.formatmm` is used to extract year and month from a DateTime object, and these two values are then concatenated together as an integer. 

If you have any special instructions, please provide them so I can customize the function accordingly.
